column3: @fanquake: can you have a look at this? IIRC, you are a doxygen guy?\n

What is the result of this in the rendered doxygen?
I don't like changing every single comment in the source code.
Would be good to focus on documentation bottlenecks: definitions of global variables, types, functions and methods.
Please also include the diff in the _rendered_ output of doxygen. Only changes to comments where you can influence the output meaningful are preferred.\n

NACK. I doubt we want all these comments in the rendered doxygen output; most of these are useless if read anywhere but the source. Per [the developer notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#doxygen-comments), we only want to doxygen-document functions, methods, and fields.\n
This is how the changed comments in Addrman appear.\n![doxygen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/863730/11734965/e15721be-9ff6-11e5-8615-ee49eb954eba.png)\n
Ok, closing this.\nBlanketly making function-internal comments visible in doxygen can be confusing, and generates a way-too-large diff.\n
We don't want any of these comments included in Doxygen, as they don't add value to the dev documentation.\n
As pointed out, we also don't want these comments included, as they make the most sense in the context of the code. I'll add some screenshots of what they look like in Doxygen to this thread.\n
